summary: alphaviruses circulating in the Old World (OW) most commonly cause febrile illness and painful arthralgias or polyarthralgias. new world (NW) alphaviruses target the central nervous system, except Mayaro virus, which is considered an arthritogenic agent like OW alphaviruses. antiviral drugs against VEEV are lacking, and antiviral compounds in development are still at the first stages of evaluation (12–14) a better understanding of how viral mRNA is transcribed and capped is essential for the development of screening tools for agents against VEEV and other alphaviruses. the alphavirus
